meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of an encyclopedia.
meanings.sent1: Her encyclopedic knowledge of animals amazed everyone at the zoo.
meanings.sent2: The encyclopedic book contained information on various historical events.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his encyclopedic memory only worked for trivia nights.
meanings.sent4: Her encyclopedic mind was like a library filled with endless facts.
meanings.sent5: The encyclopedic nature of the documentary made it a valuable resource for students.

meanings.definition: Comprehensive in scope or content; covering a wide range of subjects.
meanings.sent1: The encyclopedic collection of recipes in the cookbook impressed the chef.
meanings.sent2: His encyclopedic understanding of technology made him a sought-after consultant.
meanings.sent3: The encyclopedic list of chores seemed never-ending to the tired parents.
meanings.sent4: Her encyclopedic grasp of languages allowed her to communicate with people from all over the world.
meanings.sent5: The encyclopedic approach of the course ensured that students learned about various cultures.
